physical_examinations.vital_signs: Opening pressure during procedure: >40 cm H2O; Postoperative opening pressure: 45 cm H2O
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Large head, broad flat nasal bridge, hypertelorism, bilateral facial nerve paralysis, almost complete bilateral hearing loss, umbilicated shunt reservoir, valve set for high pressure, diffuse hyperostosis with thickened calvaria measuring up to 3.8 cm, significantly narrowed foramina, occlusion of shunt catheter.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant increase in the size of the frontal horns of the lateral ventricles compared with last CT scan acquired a few months earlier.
